00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *
00050  *  File:  m_sh.h
00051  *
00052  *  Description: Defines symbols used for reference in Mspec and code
00053  *              generator.
00054  *
00055  *  Creation Date: Oct, 1996
00056  *
00057  *  Author: Yoji Yamada, Wen-mei Hwu
00058  *
00059  *  Revisions:
00060  *      Oct, 1996, Yoji Yamada
00061  *          Modified from m_sparc.h to support SH.
00062  *      March, 1997, Daniel Lavery
00063  *          Add SuperH processor specific opcodes
00064  *
00065 \*****************************************************************************/
00066 
00067 /*****************************************************************************\
00068  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00069  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00070  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00071  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00072  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00073  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00074  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00075 \*****************************************************************************/
00076 
00077 #ifndef M_SH_H
00078 #define M_SH_H
00079 
00080 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00081 #include <config.h>
00082 #include <machine/m_spec.h>
00083 
00084 /*
00085  *      WARNING WARNING WARNING!!
00086  *      Any updates to this file must be reflected in m_impact.h.  See Rick
00087  *      or Scott for details.
00088  */
00089 
00090 /*
00091  * Declarations for processor models
00092  */
00093 enum
00094 {
00095   M_SH_1,                       /* model 1 */
00096   M_SH_2                        /* model 2 */
00097 };
00098 
00099 /*
00100  * Declarations for macros
00101  */
00102 enum
00103 {
00104   L_SH_MAC_LEAF = 100,          /* 1 if leaf function */
00105   L_SH_MAC_ALLOC,               /* total alloc space requirements */
00106   L_SH_MAC_CALLEE,              /* # of callee save registers */
00107   L_SH_MAC_CALLER,              /* # of caller save registers */
00108   L_SH_MAC_SR,                  /* sr, status register */
00109   L_SH_MAC_PR                   /* pr, procedure register */
00110 };
00111 
00112 
00113 /* Define sh specific mdes IO_set specifiers */
00114 #define MDES_OPERAND_sh_icc             100
00115 #define MDES_OPERAND_sh_fcc             101
00116 
00117 
00118 /* SH Processor Specific Opcodes */
00119 #define LSHop_SETJMP_JSR        1000
00120 #define LSHop_LDD_INT           1001
00121 #define LSHop_STD_INT           1002
00122 #define LSHop_CRA               1003    /* control reg access for Y reg */
00123 #define LSHop_SAVE              1004
00124 #define LSHop_RESTORE           1005
00125 #define LSHop_NEG               1006    /* NEG (negate) instruction: NEG Rm,Rn
00126                                            Mcode: 0 - Rm -> Rn */
00127 #define LSHop_MOVT              1007    /* MOVT (move T bit) instruction: 
00128                                            MOVT Rn
00129                                            Mcode: mov Rn, MAC_SR */
00130 #define LSHop_MOVA              1008    /* MOVA (move ea) instruction: 
00131                                            MOVA Rn, ea
00132                                            Mcode: mov Rn, ea */
00133 #define LSHop_TST               1009    /* TST (test logical) instruction: 
00134                                            TST Rn,Rn
00135                                            Mcode: eq MAC_SR, Rn, 0 */
00136 #define LSHop_CMPPL             1010    /* CMP/PL (compare) instruction: 
00137                                            CMP/PL Rn
00138                                            Mcode: gt MAC_SR, Rn, 0 */
00139 #define LSHop_CMPPZ             1011    /* CMP/PZ (compare) instruction: 
00140                                            CMP/PZ Rn
00141                                            Mcode: ge MAC_SR, Rn, 0 */
00142 #define LSHop_STSL              1012    /* STS.L (store system register) 
00143                                            instruction: STS.L PR,@-Rn
00144                                            Mcode: st_pre_i Rn, Rn, 0, PR, -4 */
00145 #define LSHop_LDSL              1013    /* LDS.L (load system register) 
00146                                            instruction: LDS.L @Rm+,PR
00147                                            Mcode: ld_post_i PR, Rm, Rm, 0, 4 */
00148
